articles.description: Unless there is a vaccine, it could be four or five years before enough people have had Covid-19 that it becomes just another endemic virus
articles.content:
It could be four to five years before the Covid-19 pandemic is under control, a senior global health official has said.
Soumya Swaminathan, the World Health Organisation's (WHO) chief scientist, told the FT's Global Boardroom digital conference: "I would say… [+4869 chars]

articles.author: Craig Williams, Gary Armstrong, Laura Ferguson
articles.title: Glasgow coronavirus updates - number of deaths in Scotland passes 2,000 mark - Glasgow Live
articles.description: The latest from Nicola Sturgeon's daily briefing.
articles.content:
Nicola Sturgeon gives update on testing abilities for Scotland
The First Minister has given updated information on the testing abilities and opportunities for people in Scotland.

articles.author: By Colin Fernadez For The Daily Mail
articles.title: Women who get a caffeine fix two or three times a day have less body fat than those who drink none - Daily Mail
articles.description: Women who enjoy two or three cups of coffee a day have less body fat than those who drink less or none at all. Coffee may contain compounds with anti-obesity properties that cause body fat to fall.
articles.content:
Many of us will reach for a coffee when were looking for a quick pick-me-up.
But it turns out our daily caffeine fix can also provide surprising health benefits.
A study has found that women who enjoy two or three cups of coffee a day have less body fat tha… [+3958 chars]

articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/bbcnews
articles.title: Coronavirus: Why hasn't the UK listed loss of smell as a symptom of Covid-19? - BBC News
articles.description: Some scientists argue that it is becoming urgent to tell people with sudden loss of smell to self-isolate.
articles.content:
Image copyrightGetty Images
Government advisers have been considering since March whether to include loss of smell among the criteria for deciding whether someone has Covid-19. Evidence that it is one of the symptoms is already strong and some scientists arg… [+10754 chars]

articles.author: By Ed Riley Luke Andrews For Mailonline
articles.title: Mother suffering from coronavirus 'collapsed to the ground in agony' before giving birth to a boy - Daily Mail
articles.description: Mother Kimberly Phillips, 44, had tested positive for coronavirus. Coolio Carl Justin Morgan was born at the Princess of Wales Hospital in Bridgend, south Wales, with a low heart rate on May 2.
articles.content:
A mother-to-be who was suffering from coronavirus collapsed to the ground in agony before giving birth to a baby boy who died three days later, the child's heartbroken father has revealed. 
Coolio Carl Justin Morgan was born at the Princess of Wales Hospital… [+7098 chars]

articles.author: By Barbara Davies for the Daily Mail
articles.title: Belly Mujinga's family tell of their shattering loss, and demand answers... and justice - Daily Mail
articles.description: Belly Mujinga, 47, a ticket officer at London's Victoria Station, died from coronavirus after a man who claimed to have Covid-19 spat in her face and then ran off.
articles.content:
For Belly Mujinga, Mothering Sunday this year was memorable for the best and the worst of reasons. 
It began with a moment of heart-warming joy as she opened a card from her 11-year-old daughter Ingrid telling her how adored she was: 'I hope to be a mother l… [+11215 chars]
